  • Method Details

    • escape

      public static char escape(char ch)
      Checks if a character needs to be escaped, and if so, returns its corresponding escape character. When escaping entire strings, escape characters need to be preceded by a backslash.
      Parameters:
      ch - the character to check
      Returns:
      its corresponding escape character, or `Character.MAX_VALUE` if this character does not require escaping

    • unescape

      public static char unescape(char ch)
      Turns an escape character into its true character.
      Parameters:
      ch - the escape character
      Returns:
      the actual character, or `Character.MAX_VALUE` if `ch` does not represent a valid escape character.

    • escape

      public static String escape(String s)

    • unescape

      public static String unescape(String s, boolean trimQuotes)

    • numberType

      public static Type numberType(CharSequence s)
      Checks if a string represents a valid number, and if so, whether it is integral or floating-point.
      Parameters:
      s - the string to check
      Returns:
      `Double.class` if the string is fractional, `Long.class` if integral, or `null` if it is not a valid number.

    • isAsciiLetter

      public static boolean isAsciiLetter(char ch)

    • formatSimpleDouble

      public static String formatSimpleDouble(double d)
      Formats a floating-point number. Unlike Double.toString, omits the decimal point if this number is not fractional.
      Parameters:
      d -
      Returns:

    • makeKey

      public static String makeKey(String s)
      Turns a string into a conforming string key, which is always lowercase and only contains letters, numbers, and hyphens. TODO: examples "Kirchäckerstraße" ==> "kirchaeckerstrasse"
      Parameters:
      s -
      Returns:
